cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. December 1940.SECRET. Copy No.W.M. (40)305th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 305 (40).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at the Cabinet War Room,S.W. 1, on Thursday, December 12, 1940, at 9-45 p.m.Present:The Rt. Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Lord Privy Seal (in the Chair).The Rt. Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P.,Minister without Portfolio.The Right Hon. Viscount Halifax,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Lord Beaverbrook,Minister of Aircraft Production.The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,MR., Chancellor of the Exchequer.The following were also present:The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,MR., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., MR., Secretary ofState for Air.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F. A.Portal, Chief of the Air Staff.The Rt. hon. Anthony Eden, MR.,Secretary of State for War.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Lieut.-General Sir Robert Haining,Vice-Chief of the Imperial GeneralStaff.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Mr. W. D. Wilkinson.Air Policy: A record of the discussion and of the Conclusions reached byOperation the War Cabinet on the subject of this operation is contained in" Abigail." the Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Richmond Terrace, S.W. 1,December 12, 1940.[22024]
